org.spongepowered.api.world.extent

Interface Extent

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BiomeArea, BlockVolume, EntityUniverse, TileEntityVolume, WeatherUniverse
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Chunk, World

    public interface Extent
extends EntityUniverse, TileEntityVolume, WeatherUniverse, BiomeArea
    Contains blocks, tile entities, entities, and possibly other game objects.

      • getBlockType

        BlockType getBlockType(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
        Get the base type of block.

        The type does not include block data such as the contents of inventories.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        Returns:
        The type of block

      • setBlockType

        void setBlockType(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position,
                  BlockType type)
        Replace the block at this position by a new type.

        This will remove any extended block data at the given position.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        type - The new type

      • getBlockSnapshot

        BlockSnapshot getBlockSnapshot(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
        Get a snapshot of this block at the current point in time.

        A snapshot is disconnected from the Extent that it was taken from so changes to the original block do not affect the snapshot.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        Returns:
        A snapshot

      • getBlockSnapshot

        BlockSnapshot getBlockSnapshot(int x,
                               int y,
                               int z)
        Get a snapshot of this block at the current point in time.

        A snapshot is disconnected from the Extent that it was taken from so changes to the original block do not affect the snapshot.

        Parameters:

        y - The Y position
        z - The Z position
        Returns:
        A snapshot

      • setBlockSnapshot

        void setBlockSnapshot(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position,
                      BlockSnapshot snapshot)
        Replace the block at this position with a copy of the given snapshot.

        Changing the snapshot afterwards will not affect the block that has been placed at this location.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        snapshot - The snapshot

      • getBlockData

        <T> Optional<T> getBlockData(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position,
                             Class<T> dataClass)
        Get an instance of the given data class for this block.

        For example, if this block represents a sign, getBlockData(Sign.class) would yield an instance of Sign to change the contents of the sign. However, if this block does not represent a sign, then an instance will not be returned.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of data
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        dataClass - The data class
        Returns:
        An instance of the class

      • getBlockData

        <T> Optional<T> getBlockData(int x,
                             int y,
                             int z,
                             Class<T> dataClass)
        Get an instance of the given data class for this block.

        For example, if this block represents a sign, getBlockData(Sign.class) would yield an instance of Sign to change the contents of the sign. However, if this block does not represent a sign, then an instance will not be returned.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of data
        Parameters:
        x - The X position
        y - The Y position
        z - The Z position
        dataClass - The data class
        Returns:
        An instance of the class

      • getLuminance

        byte getLuminance(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
        Get the light level for this object.

        Higher levels indicate a higher luminance.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        Returns:
        A light level, nominally between 0 and 15, inclusive

      • getLuminance

      • getLuminanceFromSky

        byte getLuminanceFromSky(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
        Get the light level for this object that is caused by an overhead sky.

        Higher levels indicate a higher luminance. If no sky is overheard, the return value may be 0.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        Returns:
        A light level, nominally between 0 and 15, inclusive

      • getLuminanceFromSky

        byte getLuminanceFromSky(int x,
                         int y,
                         int z)
        Get the light level for this object that is caused by an overhead sky.

        Higher levels indicate a higher luminance. If no sky is overheard, the return value may be 0.

        Parameters:
        x - The X position
        y - The Y position
        z - The Z position
        Returns:
        A light level, nominally between 0 and 15, inclusive

      • getData

        <T extends DataManipulator<T>> Optional<T> getData(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position,
                                                   Class<T> dataClass)
        Gets an instance of the given data class for given block at the location.

        If there is no pre-existing data that can be represented by the given DataManipulator class, Optional.absent() is returned.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of data
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        dataClass - The data class
        Returns:
        An instance of the class, if not available

      • getOrCreate

        <T extends DataManipulator<T>> Optional<T> getOrCreate(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position,
                                                       Class<T> manipulatorClass)
        Gets or creates a new DataManipulator that can be accepted by the block at the location. In the event that there is no data that can be represented by the given DataManipulator, a new DataManipulator object is created with default values.

        In the event the DataManipulator can not represent any data pertaining to the block at the location, Optional.absent() is returned.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of data
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        manipulatorClass - The data class
        Returns:
        An instance of the class, if not available

      • getOrCreate

        <T extends DataManipulator<T>> Optional<T> getOrCreate(int x,
                                                       int y,
                                                       int z,
                                                       Class<T> manipulatorClass)
        Gets or creates a new DataManipulator that can be accepted by the block at the location. In the event that there is no data that can be represented by the given DataManipulator, a new DataManipulator object is created with default values.

        In the event the DataManipulator can not represent any data pertaining to the block at the location, Optional.absent() is returned.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of data
        Parameters:
        x - The X position
        y - The Y position
        z - The Z position
        manipulatorClass - The data class
        Returns:
        An instance of the class, if not available

      • remove

        <T extends DataManipulator<T>> boolean remove(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position,
                                              Class<T> manipulatorClass)
        Attempts to remove the given DataManipulator represented by the block at the given location if possible.

        Certain DataManipulators can not be removed due to certain dependencies relying on the particular data to function.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of data
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        manipulatorClass - The data class
        Returns:
        If the manipulator was removed

      • offer

        <T extends DataManipulator<T>> DataTransactionResult offer(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position,
                                                           T manipulatorData)
        Offers the given DataManipulator to the block at the given position.

        In the event that the DataManipulator contains data that would otherwise overlap existing data on the block at the given position, a default DataPriority.DATA_MANIPULATOR is used.

        If any data is rejected or existing data is replaced, the DataTransactionResult will retain the rejected and replaced data.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of manipulator data
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        manipulatorData - The manipulator data to offer
        Returns:
        The transaction result

      • offer

        <T extends DataManipulator<T>> DataTransactionResult offer(int x,
                                                           int y,
                                                           int z,
                                                           T manipulatorData)
        Offers the given DataManipulator to the block at the given position.

        In the event that the DataManipulator contains data that would otherwise overlap existing data on the block at the given position, a default DataPriority.DATA_MANIPULATOR is used.

        If any data is rejected or existing data is replaced, the DataTransactionResult will retain the rejected and replaced data.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of manipulator data
        Parameters:
        x - The X position
        y - The Y position
        z - The Z position
        manipulatorData - The manipulator data to offer
        Returns:
        The transaction result

      • getManipulators

        Collection<? extends DataManipulator<?>> getManipulators(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
        Gets an copied collection of all known DataManipulators belonging to the block at the given position. An individual DataManipulator can be used for creating new data to replace on the block at the given position.
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        Returns:
        A collection of copied data manipulators belonging to the block at the given position

      • getProperty

        <T extends Property<?,?>> Optional<T> getProperty(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position,
                                                  Class<T> propertyClass)
        Attempts to retrieve a specific Property type of this the block at the given position. If the property is not applicable, Optional.absent() is returned.

        Propertys can define various immutable information about a the block at the given position that is dependent on the instance of the holder. As Propertys cannot be changed, the the block at the given position can not change the information about it's own properties either.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of property
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        propertyClass - The property class
        Returns:
        The property, if available

      • getProperty

        <T extends Property<?,?>> Optional<T> getProperty(int x,
                                                  int y,
                                                  int z,
                                                  Class<T> propertyClass)
        Attempts to retrieve a specific Property type of the block at the given position. If the property is not applicable, Optional.absent() is returned.

        Propertys can define various immutable information about a the block at the given position that is dependent on the instance of the holder. As Propertys cannot be changed, the the block at the given position can not change the information about it's own properties either.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of property
        Parameters:
        x - The X position
        y - The Y position
        z - The Z position
        propertyClass - The property class
        Returns:
        The property, if available

      • getProperties

        Collection<? extends Property<?,?>> getProperties(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
        Gets an immutable collection of all known Propertys pertaining to the block at the given position.

        Propertys can not be changed such that the property is attached to the instance of the residing DataHolder.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        Returns:
        An immutable collection of all known Propertys

      • validateRawData

        boolean validateRawData(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position,
                        DataContainer container)
        Validates the container with known data required to set the raw data to the block at the given position. If the container is incomplete or contains invalid data, false is returned.

        This validation should be checked prior to calling setRawData(Vector3i, DataContainer) to avoid exceptions.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        container - The raw data to validate
        Returns:
        True if the data is valid

      • validateRawData

        boolean validateRawData(int x,
                        int y,
                        int z,
                        DataContainer container)
        Validates the container with known data required to set the raw data to the block at the given position. If the container is incomplete or contains invalid data, false is returned.

        This validation should be checked prior to calling setRawData(Vector3i, DataContainer) to avoid exceptions.

        Parameters:
        x - The X position
        y - The Y position
        z - The Z position
        container - The raw data to validate
        Returns:
        True if the data is valid

      • setRawData

        void setRawData(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position,
                DataContainer container)
         throws InvalidDataException
        Attempts to set all data of the block at the given position according to the DataContainer's held information. Using this to modify known DataManipulators is unsupported and if the data is invalid, an InvalidDataException is thrown.

        This setter is used to provide setting custom data that is not represented by the Data API, including forge mods and other unknown data. Attempts at validating known DataManipulators contained in the data container are made with the assumption that all necessary data exists.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        container - A container containing all raw data to set on the block at the given position
        Throws:
        InvalidDataException - If the container is missing or has invalid data that this holder will refuse

      • setRawData

        void setRawData(int x,
                int y,
                int z,
                DataContainer container)
         throws InvalidDataException
        Attempts to set all data of the block at the given position according to the DataContainer's held information. Using this to modify known DataManipulators is unsupported and if the data is invalid, an InvalidDataException is thrown.

        This setter is used to provide setting custom data that is not represented by the Data API, including forge mods and other unknown data. Attempts at validating known DataManipulators contained in the data container are made with the assumption that all necessary data exists.

        Parameters:
        x - The X position
        y - The Y position
        z - The Z position
        container - A container containing all raw data to set on the block at the given position
        Throws:
        InvalidDataException - If the container is missing or has invalid data that this holder will refuse
